references price stability.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Forecast: }A sentence pertaining to future economic growth expectations.\n    \\item \\textit{Export Performance: }A sentence pertaining to the export level \n    \\item \\textit{Consumer Demand: }A sentence pertaining to consumer demand and consumer spending level  \n    \\item \\textit{Employment Levels: }A sentence pertaining to employment\n    \\item \\textit{Exchange Rate Movements: }A sentence pertaining to the value of the Swiss Franc.\n    \\item \\textit{Banking Industry: }A sentence pertaining to Switzerland\'s banking industry.\n    \\item \\textit{Tourism: }A sentence pertaining to the tourism level in Switzerland.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item "The economy has remained relatively robust despite the deterioration in the world economy, but the slowdown is likely to continue over the months to come."\\newline\\textbf{Dovish: }The economic is projected to slowdown so the SNB will be inclined to promote spending.\n    \\item "Since the indicators for the demand for labour are still at a high level, the rise in employment is likely to continue in the first part of 2008."\\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The SNB expects employment to increase causing more money to enter into the economy.\n    \\item "Inflationary pressure from abroad will remain weak."\\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }This statement does not directly comment on the state of the Swiss economy. \n    \\item "Through to the second quarter of 2007, this curve is a little higher than for June."\\newline\n    \\textbf{Irrelevant: }It is unclear what this statement is referring to. \n    \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Swiss National Bank}} monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Forecast} & When GDP is increasing. & When GDP is decreasing. & When GDP growth rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. or the Swiss Average Rate Overnight (SARON).\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation Rate: }A sentence pertaining to the inflation rate, consumer price index, or some other inflation-related metric  or references price stability.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Forecast: }A sentence pertaining to future economic growth expectations.\n    \\item \\textit{Export Performance: }A sentence pertaining to the export level \n    \\item \\textit{Consumer Demand: }A sentence pertaining to consumer demand and consumer spending level  \n    \\item \\textit{Employment Levels: }A sentence pertaining to employment\n    \\item \\textit{Exchange Rate Movements: }A sentence pertaining to the value of the Swiss Franc.\n    \\item \\textit{Banking Industry: }A sentence pertaining to Switzerland\'s banking industry.\n    \\item \\textit{Tourism: }A sentence pertaining to the tourism level in Switzerland.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item "The economy has remained relatively robust despite the deterioration in the world economy, but the slowdown is likely to continue over the months to come."\\newline\\textbf{Dovish: }The economic is projected to slowdown so the SNB will be inclined to promote spending.\n    \\item "Since the indicators for the demand for labour are still at a high level, the rise in employment is likely to continue in the first part of 2008."\\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The SNB expects employment to increase causing more money to enter into the economy.\n    \\item "Inflationary pressure from abroad will remain weak."\\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }This statement does not directly comment on the state of the Swiss economy. \n    \\item "Through to the second quarter of 2007, this curve is a little higher than for June."\\newline\n    \\textbf{Irrelevant: }It is unclear what this statement is referring to. \n forecast inflation remains low for the next few years\n                '}]

monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Forecast} & When GDP is increasing. & When GDP is decreasing. & When GDP growth rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. increasing. & When consumer demand is weak and spending is low a. & When the economy is growing at a sustainable rate in line with expectations. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Exchange Rate Movements} & When Franc is depreciating. & When currency is appreciating. & When currency value is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to the SNB will be inclined to promote spending.\n    \\item "Since the indicators for the demand for labour are still at a high level, the rise in employment is likely to continue in the first part of 2008."\\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The SNB expects employment to increase causing more money to enter into the economy.\n    \\item "Inflationary pressure from abroad will remain weak."\\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }This statement does not directly comment on the state of the Swiss economy. \n    \\item "Through to the second quarter of 2007, this curve is a little higher than for June."\\newline\n    \\textbf{Irrelevant: }It is unclear what this statement is referring to. \n    \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\\newpage\n\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{Swiss National Bank}} \\label{tb:snb_mp_stance_guide}\\\\ \n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When interest rate or SARON rate is high. & When interest rate or SARON rate is low. & When interest rate or SARON rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation more than the target of 2\\%. & When inflation is below the desired level. & When is at the target of 0-2\\%. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Forecast} & When GDP is increasing. & When GDP is decreasing. & When GDP growth rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Export Performance} & When exports are performing better than expected and earnings are rising. & When exports are declining and earnings are falling. & When exports are as expected and the rate is sustainable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Consumer Demand} & When consumer demand is higher than expected and inflation is increasing. & When consumer demand is weak and spending is low a. & When the economy is growing at a sustainable rate in line with expectations. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Employment Levels} & When unemployment is very low. & When unemployment is high. & Unemployment is at a sustainable level and within projections. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Exchange Rate Movements} & When Franc is depreciating. & When currency is appreciating. & When currency value is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Banking Industry} & When the banking industry is growing too quickly. & When the global economy is weak and financial activity is low, harming the bank-dependent Swiss economy. & When the banking industry is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Tourism} & When the tourism season is very active. & When tourism levels are weak. & When tourism levels are as expected. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: any tightening of monetary conditions is inappropriate in this depressed environment\n                '}]

or the Swiss Average Rate Overnight (SARON).\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation Rate: }A sentence pertaining to the inflation rate, consumer price index, or some other inflation-related metric  or references price stability.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Forecast: }A sentence pertaining to future economic growth expectations.\n    \\item \\textit{Export Performance: }A sentence pertaining to the export level \n    \\item \\textit{Consumer Demand: }A sentence pertaining to consumer demand and consumer spending level  \n    \\item \\textit{Employment Levels: }A sentence pertaining to employment\n    \\item \\textit{Exchange Rate Movements: }A sentence pertaining to the value of the Swiss Franc.\n    \\item \\textit{Banking Industry: }A sentence pertaining to Switzerland\'s banking industry.\n    \\item \\textit{Tourism: }A sentence pertaining to the tourism level in Switzerland.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item "The economy has remained relatively robust despite the deterioration in the world economy, but the slowdown is likely to continue over the months to come."\\newline\\textbf{Dovish: }The economic is projected to slowdown so the SNB will be inclined to promote spending.\n    \\item "Since the indicators for the demand for labour are still at a high level, the rise in employment is likely to continue in the first part of 2008."\\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The SNB expects employment to increase causing more money to enter into the economy.\n    \\item "Inflationary pressure from abroad will remain weak."\\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }This statement does not directly comment on the state of the Swiss economy. \n    \\item "Through to the second quarter of 2007, this curve is a little higher than for June."\\newline\n    \\textbf{Irrelevant: }It is unclear what this statement is referring to. \n expected and the rate is sustainable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Consumer Demand} & When consumer demand is higher than expected and inflation is increasing. & When consumer demand is weak and spending is low a. & When the economy is growing at a sustainable rate in line with expectations. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. tourism levels are weak. & When tourism levels are as expected. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the economic signals for the coming months remain favourable\n                '}]

or the Swiss Average Rate Overnight (SARON).\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation Rate: }A sentence pertaining to the inflation rate, consumer price index, or some other inflation-related metric  or references price stability.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Forecast: }A sentence pertaining to future economic growth expectations.\n    \\item \\textit{Export Performance: }A sentence pertaining to the export level \n    \\item \\textit{Consumer Demand: }A sentence pertaining to consumer demand and consumer spending level  \n    \\item \\textit{Employment Levels: }A sentence pertaining to industry.\n    \\item \\textit{Tourism: }A sentence pertaining to the tourism level in Switzerland.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item "The economy has remained relatively robust despite the deterioration in the world economy, but the slowdown is likely to continue over the months to come."\\newline\\textbf{Dovish: }The economic is projected to slowdown so the SNB will be inclined to promote spending.\n    \\item "Since the indicators for the demand for labour are still at a high level, the rise in employment is likely to continue in the first part of 2008."\\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The SNB expects employment to increase causing more money to enter into the economy.\n    \\item "Inflationary pressure from abroad will remain monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Forecast} & When GDP is increasing. & When GDP is decreasing. & When GDP growth rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Export Performance} & When exports are performing better than expected and earnings are rising. & When exports are declining and earnings are falling. & When exports are as expected and the rate is sustainable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Consumer Demand} & When consumer demand is higher than expected and inflation is increasing. & When consumer demand is weak and spending is low a. & When the economy is growing at a sustainable rate in line with expectations. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Exchange Rate Movements} & When Franc is depreciating. & When currency is appreciating. & When currency value is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Banking Industry} & When the banking industry is growing too quickly. & When the global economy is weak and financial activity is low, harming the bank-dependent Swiss economy. & When the banking industry is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Tourism} & When the tourism season is very active. & When tourism levels are weak. & When tourism levels are as expected. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the gradual improvement of the global economy is likely to further strengthen foreign demand for swiss goods and services\n                '}]

"label": "hawkish",
"justification": "The sentence suggests an increase in foreign demand for Swiss goods and services, which could lead to economic growth and inflation, prompting the SNB to take a hawkish stance."
}

weak."\\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }This statement does not directly comment on the state of the Swiss economy. \n    \\item "Through to the second quarter of 2007, this curve is a little higher than for June."\\newline\n    \\textbf{Irrelevant: }It is unclear what this statement is referring to. \n or the Swiss Average Rate Overnight (SARON).\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation Rate: }A sentence pertaining to the inflation rate, consumer price index, or some other inflation-related metric  or references price stability.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Forecast: }A sentence pertaining to future economic growth expectations.\n    \\item \\textit{Export Performance: }A sentence pertaining to the export level \n    \\item \\textit{Consumer Demand: }A sentence pertaining to consumer demand and consumer spending level  \n    \\item \\textit{Employment Levels: }A sentence pertaining to employment\n    \\item \\textit{Exchange Rate Movements: }A sentence pertaining to the value of the Swiss Franc.\n    \\item \\textit{Banking Industry: }A sentence pertaining to Switzerland\'s banking industry.\n    \\item \\textit{Tourism: }A sentence pertaining to the tourism level in Switzerland.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item "The economy has remained relatively robust despite the deterioration in the world economy, but the slowdown is likely to continue over the months to come."\\newline\\textbf{Dovish: }The economic is projected to slowdown so the SNB will be inclined to promote spending.\n    \\item "Since the indicators for the demand for labour are still at a high level, the rise in employment is likely to continue in the first part of 2008."\\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The SNB expects employment to increase causing more money to enter into the economy.\n    \\item "Inflationary pressure from abroad will remain weak."\\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }This statement does not directly comment on the state of the Swiss economy. \n    \\item "Through to the second quarter of 2007, this curve is a little higher than for June."\\newline\n    \\textbf{Irrelevant: }It is unclear what this statement is referring to. \n assumption, however, gdp growth is likely to be negative for the year as a whole\n                '}]

or the Swiss Average Rate Overnight (SARON).\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation Rate: }A sentence pertaining to the inflation rate, consumer price index, or some other inflation-related metric  or references price stability.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Forecast: }A sentence pertaining to future economic growth expectations.\n    \\item \\textit{Export Performance: }A sentence pertaining to the export level \n    \\item \\textit{Consumer Demand: }A sentence pertaining to consumer demand and consumer spending level  \n    \\item \\textit{Employment Levels: }A sentence pertaining to relatively robust despite the deterioration in the world economy, but the slowdown is likely to continue over the months to come."\\newline\\textbf{Dovish: }The economic is projected to slowdown so the SNB will be inclined to promote spending.\n    \\item "Since the indicators for the demand for labour are still at a high level, the rise in employment is likely to continue in the first part of 2008."\\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The SNB expects employment to increase causing more money to enter into the economy.\n    \\item "Inflationary pressure from abroad will remain weak."\\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }This statement does not directly comment on the state of the Swiss economy. \n    \\item "Through to the second quarter of 2007, this curve is a little higher than monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Forecast} & When GDP is increasing. & When GDP is decreasing. & When GDP growth rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Export Performance} & When exports are performing better than expected and earnings are rising. & When exports are declining and earnings are falling. & When exports are as expected and the rate is sustainable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Consumer Demand} & When consumer demand is higher than expected and inflation is increasing. & When consumer demand is weak and spending is low a. & When the economy is growing at a sustainable rate in line with expectations. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Exchange Rate Movements} & When Franc is depreciating. & When currency is appreciating. & When currency value is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Banking Industry} & When the banking industry is growing too quickly. & When the global economy is weak and financial activity is low, harming the bank-dependent Swiss economy. & When the banking industry is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Tourism} & When the tourism season is very active. & When tourism levels are weak. & When tourism levels are as expected. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: recent indicators show that this is again having a detrimental impact on economic activity\n                '}]

the SNB will be inclined to promote spending.\n    \\item "Since the indicators for the demand for labour are still at a high level, the rise in employment is likely to continue in the first part of 2008."\\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The SNB expects employment to increase causing more money to enter into the economy.\n    \\item "Inflationary pressure from abroad will remain weak."\\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }This statement does not directly comment on the state of the Swiss economy. \n    \\item "Through to the second quarter of 2007, this curve is a little higher than for June."\\newline\n    \\textbf{Irrelevant: }It is unclear what this statement is referring to. \n monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Forecast} & When GDP is increasing. & When GDP is decreasing. & When GDP growth rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. or the Swiss Average Rate Overnight (SARON).\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation Rate: }A sentence pertaining to the inflation rate, consumer price index, or some other inflation-related metric  or references price stability.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Forecast: }A sentence pertaining to future economic growth expectations.\n    \\item \\textit{Export Performance: }A sentence pertaining to the export level \n    \\item \\textit{Consumer Demand: }A sentence pertaining to consumer demand and consumer spending level  \n    \\item \\textit{Employment Levels: }A sentence pertaining to employment\n    \\item \\textit{Exchange Rate Movements: }A sentence pertaining to the value of the Swiss Franc.\n    \\item \\textit{Banking Industry: }A sentence pertaining to Switzerland\'s banking industry.\n    \\item \\textit{Tourism: }A sentence pertaining to the tourism level in Switzerland.\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item "The economy has remained relatively robust despite the deterioration in the world economy, but the slowdown is likely to continue over the months to come."\\newline\\textbf{Dovish: }The economic is projected to slowdown so the SNB will be inclined to promote spending.\n    \\item "Since the indicators for the demand for labour are still at a high level, the rise in employment is likely to continue in the first part of 2008."\\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The SNB expects employment to increase causing more money to enter into the economy.\n    \\item "Inflationary pressure from abroad will remain weak."\\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }This statement does not directly comment on the state of the Swiss economy. \n    \\item "Through to the second quarter of 2007, this curve is a little higher than monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Forecast} & When GDP is increasing. & When GDP is decreasing. & When GDP growth rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. increasing. & When consumer demand is weak and spending is low a. & When the economy is growing at a sustainable rate in line with expectations. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. tourism levels are weak. & When tourism levels are as expected. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: should the the SNB will be inclined to promote spending.\n    \\item "Since the indicators for the demand for labour are still at a high level, the rise in employment is likely to continue in the first part of 2008."\\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The SNB expects employment to increase causing more money to enter into the economy.\n    \\item "Inflationary pressure from abroad will remain weak."\\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }This statement does not directly comment on the state of the Swiss economy. \n    \\item "Through to the second quarter of 2007, this curve is a little higher than for June."\\newline\n    \\textbf{Irrelevant: }It is unclear what this statement is referring to. \n \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When interest rate or SARON rate is high. & When interest rate or SARON rate is low. & When interest rate or SARON rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Inflation Rate} & When inflation more than the target of 2\\%. & When inflation is below the desired level. & When is at the target of 0-2\\%. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Forecast} & When GDP is increasing. & When GDP is decreasing. & When GDP growth rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Export Performance} & When exports are performing better than expected and earnings are rising. & When exports are declining and earnings are falling. & When exports are as
